qadim2-pylons-desc: Before the fight, break each pylon's bar and assign kiters to tether them using flux disruptors while the tank tethers to Qadim. Break pylon bars first. Assign kiters to tether. Use flux disruptors. Tank tethers to Qadim. Tether mechanics are critical. Lost tether wipes squad. Coordinate assignments carefully.
qadim2-currents-desc: Chaos Currents (moving electric lines) travel around the arena - avoid touching them. Electric lines move around arena. Do not touch lines. Lines cause heavy damage. Watch line patterns. Move preemptively. Track currents constantly. Position safely between currents.
qadim2-retaliation-desc: After a pylon is broken, Qadim releases a knockback wave (Force of Retaliation); dodge or use stability to survive. Knockback after pylon breaks. Triggers when pylon destroyed. Use dodge or stability. Do not get knocked off. Face safe direction. Prepare for knockback. Time dodge precisely.
qadim2-anomalies-desc: When Qadim leaps to a pylon, anomalies spawn - pick up red orbs and carry them to your controlled pylon to destroy anomalies. Anomalies spawn when Qadim leaps. Pick up red orbs. Carry orbs to your pylon. Destroys anomalies. Must complete quickly. Coordinate orb carriers. Do not delay orb collection.
qadim2-havoc-desc: Force of Havoc is a long rectangular attack aimed at the tank; aim it away from group and pylons. Long rectangle attack. Aimed at tank. Tank must position carefully. Aim away from group. Aim away from pylons. Heavy damage if hit. Tank positioning is critical.
qadim2-ruin-desc: Force of Ruin fires triple missiles at random players after 60% - dodge or block them. Triple missiles after 60%. Fires at random players. Dodge or block. Watch for missile indicators. Do not stack missiles. Spread if necessary. Missiles cause heavy damage.
qadim2-fire-desc: Fire phases at 80/60/40/30/20%: stack flames between pylons, break anomaly bars inside the fire and dodge the end-of-phase shockwave. Fire phases at 80%, 60%, 40%, 30%, 20%. Stack flames between pylons. Break anomaly bars in fire. Dodge shockwave at end. Coordinate positioning. Time CC burst. Survive shockwave.
qadim2-final-desc: Final 20%: there are no pylons - survive overlapping mechanics and continue carrying orbs to stop meteors. No pylons after 20%. Survive overlapping mechanics. Still carry orbs. Orbs stop meteors. Most chaotic phase. Multi-task all mechanics. Stay focused.
qadim2-cm-twisters-desc: Avoid Titanic Twisters swirling at the arena edge - they are instant death. Twisters at arena edge. Instant death if touched. Swirl around edge. Reduce safe space. Watch arena boundary. Stay center more. Do not go near edge.
qadim2-cm-lava-desc: Rain of Chaos leaves persistent lava AoEs - reposition quickly and avoid standing in fire. Leaves persistent lava AoEs. Reposition quickly. Avoid standing in fire. Lava remains on ground. Reduces safe space. Plan movement paths. Keep arena clean if possible.
qadim2-cm-stability-desc: At 40/30/20% pylon phases, everyone must stand in the south white circle and share stability to survive the wipe mechanic. At 40%, 30%, 20% pylon phases. Stand in south white circle. Share stability as group. Wipe mechanic if failed. All must stack. Coordinate stability. Do not miss circle.
qadim2-cm-golden-desc: After each pylon phase, golden orbs appear - collect them and use your special action to stop meteor attacks. Golden orbs after pylon phases. Collect golden orbs. Use special action. Stops meteor attacks. Must collect quickly. Coordinate collectors. Meteors wipe if not stopped.
raid-greer-desc: First boss of Wing 8. Blight and corruption mechanics.
greer-phases-desc: Alternate between Greer and split phases; at 80/50/20% break Greer's bar to remove Empowered stacks and make him vulnerable. Alternate phases. Break bar at 80%, 50%, 20%. Removes Empowered stacks. Makes him vulnerable. Must break quickly. Coordinate CC burst. Vulnerable window is DPS time.
greer-cleave-desc: Stay behind Greer to avoid his frontal cleave; watch for triple shockwave pulses and dodge the final wave. Stay behind Greer. Avoid frontal cleave. Triple shockwave pulses. Dodge final wave. First two waves safe. Only final wave damages. Position carefully.
greer-orbs-desc: The furthest player attracts homing orbs; reflect or block these projectiles to prevent Greer gaining Empowered stacks. Furthest player attracts orbs. Homing projectiles. Reflect or block. Prevents Empowered stacks. Do not let orbs hit Greer. Coordinate reflects. Block if needed.
greer-circles-desc: Spread out to soak green circles (Eruption of Rot); one player per circle to avoid empowerment. Green circles spawn. Spread out. One player per circle. Soaking prevents empowerment. Multiple players empower boss. Coordinate soaking. Do not stack.
greer-vines-desc: Stomp leaps leave vine walls; avoid standing between walls and reposition after each leap. Stomp creates vine walls. Leaves walls on ground. Avoid standing between walls. Reposition after leap. Walls restrict movement. Plan positioning. Clear space needed.
greer-seeds-desc: Seeds of Decay spawns Empowering Beasts - kill them quickly and dodge the orange barrage. Seeds spawn Empowering Beasts. Kill quickly. Empowering Beasts buff boss. Orange barrage follows. Dodge barrage. Priority target. Burst down fast.
greer-split-desc: At 66% and 33%, split into two groups to damage Greer and his clone Reeg to 50% simultaneously. Split at 66% and 33%. Two groups needed. Damage Greer and Reeg. Must reach 50% simultaneously. Coordinate DPS. Call out percentages. Synchronize kills.
greer-cm-ereg-desc: Greer becomes Godspoil Greer; Ereg the Enabler spawns as a third Greerling - kill or manage Ereg quickly. Becomes Godspoil Greer. Ereg spawns as third Greerling. Kill Ereg quickly. Or manage carefully. Third target complicates. Coordinate focus. Prioritize appropriately.
greer-cm-proto-desc: Champion proto-greerlings spawn at 10% health - burst them down before they boost the boss. Champions spawn at 10%. Proto-greerlings appear. Burst down immediately. They boost boss. Cannot let them live. High priority. Focus fire.
greer-cm-plague-desc: Plague Rot effects (Cage of Decay, Enfeebling Miasma, Ripples of Rot) corrupt boons and apply poison; 10 stacks is fatal - cleanse and reposition. Multiple Plague Rot effects. Cage of Decay. Enfeebling Miasma. Ripples of Rot. Corrupts boons. Applies poison. 10 stacks is death. Cleanse constantly. Reposition often.
raid-decima-desc: Second boss of Wing 8. Storm and lightning mechanics.
decima-arrows-desc: The furthest player kites lightning arrows; hide behind a lightning rod to line-of-sight the red arrow or die instantly. Furthest player kites arrows. Hide behind lightning rod. Line-of-sight red arrow. Red arrow is instant death. Position rod between you and Decima. Kiter role is critical. Do not fail line-of-sight.
decima-orbs-desc: When green orbs spawn near rods, stand in them - one/two/three players depending on orb size - to dissipate charge. Green orbs spawn near rods. Stand in orbs. One, two, or three players needed. Match player count to orb size. Dissipates rod charge. Orbs must be soaked. Coordinate players for orbs.
decima-smashes-desc: A series of smashes sweeps across the arena: cross the first two half-arena hits and dodge the final cascading smash at the last moment. Series of smashes. First two are half-arena. Cross through first two. Final cascading smash. Dodge final at last moment. Timing is critical. Practice smash pattern.
decima-stomp-desc: Stomp creates shockwaves on outer and inner rings; stay in melee range and share stability to avoid being knocked back. Stomp creates shockwaves. Outer and inner rings. Stay in melee range. Share stability. Avoid knockback. Coordinate stability. Melee positioning safe.
decima-spread-desc: Orange circles appear on melee players - spread out and break the defiance bar at 75% while soaking green orbs to reset rods. Orange circles on melee. Spread out. Break bar at 75%. Soak green orbs simultaneously. Resets lightning rods. Multi-task mechanic. Coordinate CC and orbs.
decima-recharge-desc: After the break bar, soak green orbs again to recharge rods; prepare for the next phase. After break bar. Soak green orbs again. Recharges rods. Prepares for next phase. Must complete recharge. Coordinate orb soaking. Set up for phase two.
decima-phase2-desc: Phase 2: ranged (furthest) group kites arrows away from rods while avoiding Violent Winds; they cannot soak orbs during this phase. Ranged group kites arrows. Stay furthest from boss. Kite away from rods. Avoid Violent Winds. Cannot soak orbs. Melee handles orbs. Split responsibilities.
decima-phase3-desc: Phase 3: multiple arrow types occur - three melee players block the green arrow at a rod while others handle red/orange arrows and reposition. Multiple arrow types. Three melee block green arrow. Block at rod. Others handle red/orange. Reposition constantly. Complex coordination. Practice arrow assignments.
decima-cm-godsquall-desc: Decima becomes Godsquall Decima; she has more health and gains Peal of Discord stacks. Becomes Godsquall Decima. More health. Gains Peal of Discord stacks. Stacks increase difficulty. Longer fight. More mechanics. Prepare for extended fight.
decima-cm-conduits-desc: Conduits change positions and green orbs persist while rods are charged; coordinate soaking and rod rotation. Conduits change positions. Green orbs persist. Rods stay charged. Coordinate soaking. Rotate rod usage. More complex orb management. Track conduit positions.
decima-cm-attacks-desc: New attacks: Discordant Thunder, Seismic Reposition, Seismoelectric Leap and Sparking Reverberation with a break bar - dodge or break bars quickly. Discordant Thunder attack. Seismic Reposition. Seismoelectric Leap. Sparking Reverberation. Has break bar. Dodge or break quickly. Learn new patterns.
decima-cm-exposed-desc: Orange/spread arrows apply Exposed; players with charged leap must coordinate their dodge timing to avoid overlap. Orange arrows apply Exposed. Spread arrows apply Exposed. Charged leap on players. Coordinate dodge timing. Avoid overlap. Exposed increases damage. Time dodges carefully.
decima-cm-boulders-desc: Transcendent Boulders link two players - destroy both boulders simultaneously or the linked players die. Boulders link two players. Must destroy simultaneously. Both boulders at same time. Linked players die if failed. Coordinate boulder breaks. Call out linked players. Synchronize DPS.
raid-ura-desc: Final boss of Wing 8. Steam and pressure mechanics.
ura-pressure-desc: Ura gains Rising Pressure stacks every 5% health - break her bar at each 5% to reduce stacks and lower damage. Gains stacks every 5% HP. Break bar at each 5%. Reduces pressure stacks. Lowers her damage. Must break consistently. Coordinate CC timing. Track health percentages.
ura-shards-desc: Collect Bloodstone Shards to free float-trapped players and to destroy Sulfuric Geysers; rotate shard carriers because of the debuff. Collect Bloodstone Shards. Free float-trapped players. Destroy Sulfuric Geysers. Carrier gets debuff. Rotate carriers. Do not hold too long. Pass shards strategically.
ura-toxic-desc: Toxic Geysers create damaging fields - break their bars quickly to remove them. Toxic Geysers spawn. Create damaging fields. Break bars quickly. Remove geysers. Priority CC target. Do not delay. Clear toxic fields.
ura-sulfuric-desc: Sulfuric Geysers cannot be CC'd - drop a Bloodstone Shard on them or they leave Exposed puddles. Cannot be CC'd. Drop Bloodstone Shard on them. Or they leave Exposed puddles. Puddles increase damage taken. Must use shards. Prioritize dangerous geysers. Coordinate shard drops.
ura-titanspawn-desc: Titanspawn Geysers spawn champion Titans; break the bar then kill the Titan quickly before it enrages. Spawns champion Titans. Break geyser bar. Kill Titan quickly. Titan enrages if alive. High priority. Focus fire. Do not let enrage.
ura-ring-desc: Rock Ring traps a player inside eggs - stand near the group so others can break the ring quickly. Traps player in eggs. Stand near group. Others break ring. Free trapped player. Must break quickly. Position for help. Coordinate breaks.
ura-leap-desc: Ura leaps at the furthest player; avoid being targeted and sidestep the shockwave. Leaps at furthest player. Avoid being targeted. Sidestep shockwave. Heavy damage. Knockback effect. Control distance. Position safely.
ura-whirlpool-desc: Around 70% health a Whirlpool pulls everyone to center - use a Bloodstone Shard to break it or the group dies. Whirlpool at 70%. Pulls everyone to center. Use Bloodstone Shard. Break whirlpool. Group dies if not broken. Critical mechanic. Have shard ready.
ura-boons-desc: Keep Ura away from geyser fields; she gains boons and damage if she stands in them. Keep Ura away from fields. Geyser fields buff her. Gains boons and damage. Tank must kite. Position carefully. Control boss location.
ura-cm-permanent-desc: Geysers become untargetable and permanent; Titanspawn Geysers are not removed on break - manage the growing number of hazards. Geysers become permanent. Untargetable. Titanspawn not removed. Hazards accumulate. Growing difficulty. Manage space. Plan movements.
ura-cm-fumarollers-desc: Champion Fumarollers cap the arena and defiance bars are much stronger - allocate more CC. Fumarollers cap arena. Defiance bars stronger. Allocate more CC. Harder breaks. Coordinate CC skills. Save CC abilities. Burst bars quickly.
ura-cm-heal-desc: At 1% health Ura heals 15% and the timer extends; Titanic Resistance increases her bar after each break, making subsequent breaks harder. Heals 15% at 1%. Timer extends. Titanic Resistance stacks. Bar increases after breaks. Later breaks harder. Prepare for long fight. Manage CC resources.
professions-table-title: Professions & Elite Specializations by Role Type
legend-power-desc: Direct damage based on Power stat
legend-healing-desc: Support and healing for the group
glossary-item-cc-desc: Abilities that control enemies: stun, knockback, pull, immobilize, etc. Used to break defiance bars.
glossary-item-defiance-desc: Blue bar that appears under some enemies. Must be broken using CC to make the enemy vulnerable.
glossary-item-cm-desc: Challenging mode with extra mechanics and better rewards. Available in some fractals, strikes and raids.
glossary-item-kite-desc: Player responsible for keeping certain adds or mechanics away from the main group.
glossary-item-boons-desc: Positive buffs like Might, Fury, Protection, Aegis, Resistance, etc. Essential for group success.
glossary-item-stack-desc: Grouping together at one point to share boons, heals and facilitate group mechanics.
glossary-item-dps-desc: Players focused on dealing damage. Can be Power (direct damage) or Condition (damage over time).
glossary-item-healer-desc: Responsible for healing and supporting the group with boons and utilities.
glossary-item-tank-desc: Player who maintains boss attention (aggro) and positions it appropriately.
glossary-item-boonbot-desc: Player specialized in providing Quickness or Alacrity to the group.
glossary-item-players-desc: Indicates how many players are needed for the content (x5, x10, x50).
glossary-item-cm-icon-desc: "CM" badge indicates that the content has challenge mode available.
glossary-item-edit-desc: You can edit existing mechanics or add your own custom notes.
glossary-item-copy-desc: Copies the mechanics text to clipboard.
glossary-item-export-desc: Use settings to export your custom mechanics and import them on another device.
glossary-item-language-desc: The site is available in Português, English and Español. Change in the language selector.
glossary-item-mobile-desc: The site is optimized for use on mobile devices during runs.
glossary-note: Note: This glossary is a quick guide. For more detailed information, consult the official Guild Wars 2 wiki or community.
feedback-discord-desc: Join the community and send suggestions in the Support > Suggestions channel
feedback-form-desc: Send your suggestion quickly and directly
feedback-thanks: ❤️ Thank you for helping improve the project ♡
link-gw2mists-desc: Builds focused on PvP and WvW
export-mechanics-desc: Save your custom mechanics from this page to a JSON file
import-mechanics-desc: Load custom mechanics from a JSON file to this page
reset-settings-desc: Clear all settings and custom mechanics from the site
reset-confirm-message: This will delete all your settings and custom mechanics. This action cannot be undone.
shatterer-location-desc: Blazeridge Steppes - North of the map
shatterer-phase1-desc: Destroy the crystals around the Shatterer to remove its invulnerability. Watch out for ice AoE attacks
shatterer-phase2-desc: Attack the Shatterer directly. Avoid the orange circular AoEs on the ground and tail swipes
shatterer-adds-desc: Branded Champions spawn periodically. Prioritize killing them quickly as they can deal heavy damage
shatterer-breath-desc: The Shatterer does a devastating frontal breath attack. Stay on the sides or behind it during this attack
shatterer-siege-desc: Use mortars and cannons to deal extra damage. Especially useful for low-level players
tequatl-location-desc: Sparkfly Fen - South beach near Splintered Coast Waypoint
tequatl-dps-desc: Maintain constant DPS on Tequatl. The event has a 15-minute timer. Focus mainly on the head and feet
tequatl-poison-desc: Avoid the green pools on the ground that deal damage and apply heavy conditions. They appear frequently
tequatl-waves-desc: When Tequatl slams its claws on the ground, shockwaves spread out. Jump over them or dodge
tequatl-battery-desc: Group must defend 6 batteries from Risen. If a battery falls, the group fails. Organize defense teams
tequatl-turrets-desc: 6 players must use turrets on the spine bones to break Tequatl's Defiance Bar during aerial phase
tequatl-breath-desc: Tequatl does a devastating insta-kill breath attack. When it raises its head, run to the sides immediately
tequatl-coordination-desc: Event requires full map coordination. Follow commands in chat. Organized maps recommended (e.g., TTS, Attuned)
triple-trouble-location-desc: Bloodtide Coast - 3 simultaneous locations: Amber, Crimson and Cobalt Wurms
triple-trouble-coordination-desc: Hardest event in Core Tyria. Requires organized map (TTS, etc). Map divided into 3 teams of ~40 players each
triple-trouble-phasing-desc: All 3 Wurms must be killed within 2 minutes of each other. If one team fails, everyone fails
triple-trouble-amber-desc: Mechanic: Kegs. Players grab kegs and run to throw them into the wurm's mouth when it emerges. Has the shortest burn phase
triple-trouble-crimson-desc: Mechanic: Egg Chambers. Players must phase-flip to alternate world and destroy eggs. Requires reflects for projectiles
triple-trouble-cobalt-desc: Mechanic: Husks. Players must kill specific Husks to extract their essence and throw it at the wurm. Has the longest burn phase
triple-trouble-abominations-desc: Veterans that appear during the event. Must be CCed and killed quickly, or they can wipe entire squads
triple-trouble-timer-desc: 15 minutes to kill all 3 wurms. Requires high DPS and perfect mechanic execution. Use food/utilities
karka-queen-location-desc: Southsun Cove - South beach of the island
karka-queen-roll-desc: The Karka Queen rolls toward players. Dodge to the sides to avoid. Causes knock-down and heavy damage
karka-queen-spawn-desc: Young Karkas constantly spawn. Keep them under control but focus DPS on the Queen
karka-queen-armor-desc: The Queen's shell greatly reduces damage. Attack the belly (underside) when possible for maximum DPS
karka-queen-aoe-desc: The Queen spits poison pools on the ground. Avoid standing in them as they deal heavy damage and conditions
karka-queen-coordination-desc: Event requires organized map. Follow commander and keep squad together for quick revives
ley-line-location-desc: Spawns in 3 rotating maps: Timberline Falls, Iron Marches, Gendarran Fields. 20-minute rotation each
ley-line-mechanics-desc: Simple boss, just DPS. Avoid orange AoEs on the ground and maintain constant DPS
ley-line-shield-desc: The Anomaly periodically becomes invulnerable with a shield. Wait for the shield to drop and continue attacking
ley-line-teleport-desc: The Anomaly teleports to different locations on the map during the fight. Follow it quickly to not lose DPS
ley-line-reward-desc: Gives Unstable Cosmic Essence (for legendary trinkets). Quick event, ideal for daily farming
ley-line-timer-desc: Event lasts 20 minutes per map. Use the site timer to know which map is currently active
marionette-location-desc: Eye of the North (Public version) - Accessible from Lion's Arch
marionette-phases-desc: Event has 5 lanes/platforms. Each phase, all 5 lanes fight simultaneously. If one lane fails, the entire event fails
marionette-platforms-desc: Players are divided into 5 groups. Each group goes to a platform to fight a champion. Must kill the champion before timer expires (2 minutes)
marionette-champions-desc: Each platform has a different boss: Warden, Breaker, Demolisher, Sniper, and Assault Knight. Learn each mechanic to optimize DPS
marionette-cables-desc: Between phases, the Marionette does massive AoE attacks. Stand on the safe spots marked on the ground. Cables also need to be destroyed
marionette-coordination-desc: Follow commands in map chat. Distribute players evenly across all 5 lanes. Failure in one lane means failure for everyone
marionette-timer-desc: Total event time: ~20 minutes. Each champion must die in 2 minutes. 5 phases total. Requires high DPS and execution
marionette-rewards-desc: Gives unique rewards including Marionette-themed weapon skins and materials for legendary crafting
tower-location-desc: Eye of the North (Public version) - Accessible from Lion's Arch
tower-phases-desc: Escort phase, Tower assault, and Toxic Alliance bosses. Each phase has specific mechanics
tower-toxic-desc: Green toxic clouds deal massive damage and conditions. Avoid them at all costs. They appear throughout the event
tower-krait-desc: Toxic Alliance enemies: Krait and Nightmare Court. Both factions have dangerous elites and champions. Focus fire and CC
tower-spray-desc: Pick up antitoxin sprays to create safe zones in toxic areas. Essential for survival. Coordinate spray usage with squad
tower-bosses-desc: Final phase has 3 bosses: Lysis the Nightwielder, Fyronna the Skyscorcher, and Shurmoof. Kill them quickly before toxic overwhelms
tower-coordination-desc: Follow commander tags. Stack for heals and boons. Call out spray locations. Rez downed allies quickly
tower-rewards-desc: Unique Tower of Nightmares rewards including Toxic-themed weapon skins and armor pieces
battle-la-location-desc: Eye of the North (Public version) - Accessible from Lion's Arch
battle-la-objectives-desc: Event has several simultaneous objectives: Defend barricades, destroy hologram generators, escort teams, and defeat champions
battle-la-miasma-desc: Toxic clouds spread across the map. Use waypoints and safe zones. Carry antitoxin when possible
battle-la-aetherblade-desc: Scarlet's Aetherblade pirates attack with advanced technology. Watch for turrets, mines, and elite sharpshooters
battle-la-hologram-desc: Destroy hologram generators to stop enemy reinforcements. Prioritize generators before engaging enemies
battle-la-scarlet-desc: Final boss: Scarlet Briar herself. High mobility, dangerous attacks. Break her defiance bar when possible. Avoid AoE patterns
battle-la-coordination-desc: Split into multiple squads for different objectives. Follow commander instructions. Call missing objectives in chat
battle-la-rewards-desc: Battle for Lion's Arch rewards including Scarlet-themed weapons and armor, plus materials for legendary crafting
drytop-location-desc: Dry Top - Living World Season 2 map. Accessible from Brisban Wildlands
drytop-cycle-desc: Event alternates between Crash Site (40 min) and Sandstorm (20 min). Participate in events to increase reward tier
drytop-tier-desc: Complete events to raise the Favor of the Zephyrites from Tier 1 to Tier 6. Higher tiers = better rewards and access to more areas
drytop-crash-desc: 40 minutes of various events: escorts, mining, defending areas, killing champions. Spread out across the map for maximum tier gain
drytop-sandstorm-desc: 20-minute sandstorm opens new areas with sand portals. Access hidden caves and special events. Use geodes wisely
drytop-champions-desc: Various champions spawn: Dust Mite Queen, Inquest Golem, Colocal, and more. Kill them for tier progress and loot
drytop-geodes-desc: Geodes are the map currency. Use to open buried chests during Sandstorm. Farm geodes during Crash Site events
drytop-rewards-desc: Ambrite weapon skins, Zephyrite-themed armor, geode-bought rewards. T6 chests have best loot including rare materials
vb-location-desc: Verdant Brink - First zone of Heart of Thorns. Vertical jungle with Pact structures
vb-cycle-desc: Day: 75 minutes (securing/defending outposts). Night: 45 minutes (fight night bosses). Full meta = 2 hours
vb-day-desc: During the day, help the Pact secure camps and defend against Mordrem. Complete events at 5 outposts. Gain participation
vb-night-desc: At night, Mordrem attack massively. Defend outposts and fight 4 night bosses. Each boss in a different lane
vb-bosses-desc: 4 bosses spawn: Patriarch (North), Matriarch (South), Axemaster (West), Wyvern (East). Squad splits into 4 groups. Kill all for rewards
vb-participation-desc: Gain participation by doing events. Higher tiers = better rewards. Keep participation maxed by actively participating
vb-canopy-desc: Map has multiple vertical layers. Use updrafts, bouncing mushrooms and ley-line gliding. Master HoT masteries
vb-rewards-desc: Grand Chests from night bosses. Airship Cargo, treasure maps, Machetes for Hidden Treasures. Machete sells for good gold
ab-location-desc: Auric Basin - Second zone of Heart of Thorns. Golden Exalted city
ab-phases-desc: Phase 1: Pylon Power (75 min). Phase 2: Challenges (15 min). Phase 3: Octovine Boss (20 min). Total: 110 minutes
ab-pylons-desc: Activate the 4 pylons: North, South, East, West. Complete events in each area to charge pylons. Minimum 80% on each to proceed
ab-challenges-desc: 15 minutes of unique challenges in each lane after pylons. Complete challenges for buffs in the Octovine fight
ab-octovine-desc: Fight Octovine in 4 simultaneous lanes. Squad splits equally. Kill mini-bosses from each lane to expose the core
ab-bombs-desc: Pick up mushroom bombs and throw at the exposed Octovine core. Requires coordination. Bombers must be protected by squad
ab-synced-desc: All 4 lanes must kill Octovine at the same time. If one lane fails or kills too early, event may fail. Critical coordination
ab-rewards-desc: Exalted Chest (best of AB). Chance to drop precursors. Aurillium currency for Exalted armor. Multiple chests around the map
td-location-desc: Tangled Depths - Third zone of Heart of Thorns. Underground Chak labyrinth
td-phases-desc: Help the Outposts (95 min) → Prep (5 min) → Chak Gerent Boss (20 min)
td-outposts-desc: Help 4 outposts (SCAR, Ogre, Rata Novus, Nuhoch). Complete events at each outpost to prepare for the boss
td-gerent-desc: 4 simultaneous Gerents in different lanes. Each with unique mechanics. Squad splits into 4 groups
td-mechanics-desc: SCAR: Eggs + Mushrooms | Ogre: Burn phase | Rata Novus: Cannons | Nuhoch: Bombs and poison. Learn each lane's mechanics
td-timer-desc: 20 minutes to kill 4 Gerents. Requires high DPS and perfect execution. Organized maps recommended
td-navigation-desc: Most confusing map in HoT. Multiple vertical layers. Use waypoints and follow commander. Nuhoch wallows for fast movement
td-rewards-desc: Chak Egg Sac (rare), Chak weapons, armor. Large amount of Airship Cargo. Good farm for HoT materials
ds-location-desc: Dragon's Stand - Fourth and final zone of Heart of Thorns. Final boss Mordremoth
ds-duration-desc: Entire map is a 2-hour meta-event. No secondary events. Map resets after completion or failure
ds-lanes-desc: North (Pact), Central (Pale Reaver), South (Nuhoch/Ogre). Squad splits into 3 groups. Each lane advances independently
ds-towers-desc: Destroy Mordrem towers in each lane. 10 towers total. Use siege weapons and coordinate pushes with squad
ds-mordremoth-desc: After taking down all towers, fight Mordremoth. 3 phases with different mechanics. High DPS required
ds-coordination-desc: Most coordinated event in HoT. Follow commands in chat. All 3 lanes must have balanced progress. Organized maps essential
ds-pods-desc: After event, collect Mordrem Pods around the map. Used to purchase legendary armor and exclusive rewards
ds-rewards-desc: Crystallized Supply Cache (best chest in HoT). Chance for precursors, Black Diamond, armor. Mordrem Pods for unique vendor
ld-location-desc: Lake Doric - Living World Season 3 Episode 5. Krytan region under White Mantle attack
ld-rotation-desc: Meta alternates between 3 areas: Noran's Homestead (30 min), Saidra's Haven (45 min), New Loamhurst (45 min)
ld-whitemantle-desc: Free areas from White Mantle control. Capture and defense events. Complete to gain control of the region
ld-events-desc: Each location has event chain: Rally → Push → Boss. Complete in order for maximum efficiency
ld-centaurs-desc: Centaurs are allies. Help them in events to gain support in battles against White Mantle
ld-farm-desc: Excellent for farming. Leather (mainly leather), abundant wood nodes. Unbound Magic for Season 3
ld-jade-desc: Special Jade enemies appear. Strong defense, use CC. Drop valuable materials
ld-rewards-desc: Petrified Wood (ascended crafting), Unbound Magic, abundant leather. Access to Lake Doric exclusive vendors
casino-location-desc: Crystal Oasis - Path of Fire. Amnoon Casino. First PoF map
casino-rounds-desc: Event has 3 rounds of 5 minutes each. Each round is a different mini-game: Races, Treasure Hunt, or Piñata smash
casino-race-desc: Use Roller Beetle mount to race through portals. Complete circuit as fast as possible. Beetle practice essential
casino-treasure-desc: Find buried treasures around the map. Follow visual indicators on the ground. More treasures found = more points
casino-pinata-desc: After 3 rounds, Giant Piñata spawns. Simple DPS. Kill quickly for rewards. Use mounts to reach when it moves
casino-tokens-desc: Earn Casino Coins by participating. Use coins to gamble at casino for more rewards. Mini-games also drop coins
casino-fun-desc: Casual and fun event. Doesn't require heavy coordination. Good for relaxing while farming. Great for PoF beginners
casino-rewards-desc: Casino Coins, Trade Contracts (PoF currency), chances for exclusive skins. Reward chests based on participation
serpents-location-desc: Domain of Vabbi - Path of Fire. Atholma Island in the center of the map
serpents-phases-desc: Phase 1: Capture 3 shrines (15 min). Phase 2: Defend shrines and kill 3 hydra bosses (15 min). Total: 30 minutes
serpents-shrines-desc: North, East, South shrines. Squad splits into 3 equal groups. Capture all 3 shrines to activate phase 2
serpents-hydras-desc: After capturing shrines, 3 hydras spawn (one at each shrine). Each group stays at their shrine and kills their hydra. Critical coordination
serpents-heads-desc: Each hydra has multiple heads. Kill all heads to defeat the hydra. Heads respawn if too slow. Focused DPS required
serpents-branded-desc: Branded enemies spawn constantly. Deal with adds quickly but keep focus on hydra. Don't let adds overwhelm
serpents-coordination-desc: Split squad equally: 33% per shrine. Follow your commander. If shrine fails, entire event fails. Balance is key
serpents-rewards-desc: Serpent's Ire Chest. Trade Contracts, chance for Amalgamated Gemstone. PoF materials. Good farm for ascended materials
desolation-location-desc: The Desolation - Path of Fire. Sulfuric corrupted desert with Junundu
desolation-cycle-desc: Alternates between Maws of Torment (20 min) and Junundu Rising (20 min). Both events important for farming
desolation-maws-desc: Close Forged portals around the map. Kill Forged enemies that spawn. 5 simultaneous locations. Distribute players evenly
desolation-junundu-desc: Use Junundu worms to cross sulfur and fight Forged. Mount Junundu for special abilities. More fun than Maws
desolation-sulfur-desc: Sulfur fields deal heavy damage. NEVER cross without Junundu or safe zones. Instant death without protection
desolation-forged-desc: Forged enemies of Balthazar. Strong armor and fire attacks. Use CC and focus fire. Veterans and Champions dangerous
desolation-casual-desc: Simple events without heavy coordination. Good for casual farming. Junundu Rising especially fun to play
desolation-rewards-desc: Trade Contracts, PoF materials, chances for Amalgamated Gemstone. Both events give similar rewards
palawadan-location-desc: Domain of Istan - Living World Season 4 Episode 1. Grand Bazaar of Palawadan
palawadan-phases-desc: Prep (90 min) → Wave Defense (20 min) → Boss Fight (10 min). Total: 2 hours. Main Istan event
palawadan-waves-desc: Defend Grand Bazaar against Awakened waves. 3 gates to defend. Split squad between gates. Kill enemies quickly
palawadan-champs-desc: Multiple champion Awakened spawn during waves. Prioritize champions. Use CC breaks. Focused DPS essential
palawadan-akili-desc: After waves, Akili spawns. Large boss with AoE attacks. Dodge oranges, stack for heals. Break bar when possible
palawadan-farm-desc: Most farmed Season 4 event. Excellent loot per time invested. Multiple chests. Istan known for farming
palawadan-vm-desc: Drops TONS of Volatile Magic (LWS4 currency). Use VM to buy Trophy Shipments. VM converter essential for max profit
palawadan-rewards-desc: Grand Astral Chest, abundant Volatile Magic, chances for rare drops. One of best gold/hour in game. Great Halls key for extra chest
branded-location-desc: Jahai Bluffs - Living World Season 4 Episode 4. Kralkatorrik-corrupted version of the Shatterer
branded-prep-desc: 15 minutes of escort events. Protect NPCs across the map. Complete escorts to activate boss fight
branded-harder-desc: Death-Branded Shatterer is significantly stronger than normal Shatterer. More HP, more dangerous attacks, additional mechanics
branded-rifts-desc: Rifts spawn constantly during fight. Close rifts quickly or they spawn infinite adds. Split some people to rifts
branded-crystals-desc: Similar to original Shatterer: destroy crystals when it lands. Break CC bar. Focused DPS when vulnerable
branded-beam-desc: New deadly beam attack. Purple beam sweeps arena. Dodge perpendicular to beam. Instant death if hit
branded-coordination-desc: Unorganized maps often fail. Follow commander tags. Communicate rifts in chat. Stack for heals and boons
branded-rewards-desc: Shatterer Hoard Chest, Volatile Magic, chances for Branded weapons. 2-hour cooldown. LWS4 materials
dragonstorm-location-desc: Eye of the North - The Icebrood Saga finale. 50 players. Saga's final boss
dragonstorm-dragons-desc: Fight Primordus and Jormag simultaneously. Two fused Elder Dragons. Epic and cinematic event
dragonstorm-phases-desc: Phase 1: Primordus (fire). Phase 2: Jormag (ice). Phase 3: Both together. Each phase has unique and dangerous mechanics
dragonstorm-primordus-desc: Massive fire attacks, lava pools, orange AoEs. Use frost boons from Braham. Dodge fire meteors. Destroyers spawn constantly
dragonstorm-jormag-desc: Ice attacks, freeze mechanics, ice storms. Use fire boons from Ryland. Icebrood adds. Avoid ice shards falling from sky
dragonstorm-boons-desc: Get special boons: Frost to fight Primordus, Fire to fight Jormag. Braham and Ryland give buffs. Essential for survival
dragonstorm-adds-desc: Destroyer and Icebrood champions spawn. Kill adds quickly or they dominate the map. Split some players for add control
dragonstorm-rewards-desc: Dragonstorm Chest (excellent loot). Chance for precursors, ascended gear. Tyrian Defense Seals. 2-hour cooldown. Best IBS reward
de-location-desc: Dragon's End - End of Dragons. Final boss Soo-Won. Entire map is 2-hour meta-event
de-duration-desc: Prep (45 min) → Jade Maw phases (15 min) → Battle for Jade Sea (60 min). Longest and most challenging EoD event
de-prep-desc: 45 minutes of prep events around map. Secure 4 outposts. Gain extraction devices. More prep = easier boss
de-jademaw-desc: 2 fights against Void Jade Maw. Use extraction devices to remove void corruption. Critical CC bars. Tight DPS check
de-soowon-desc: Elder Dragon Soo-Won. 60 minutes of intense fight. Multiple phases. Complex mechanics. Requires organized squad and high DPS
de-tails-desc: Destroy Soo-Won's 4 tails. Squad splits into 4 groups. Use extraction devices on tails. Coordination and timing essential
de-voidpools-desc: Void pools spawn around map. Deal massive damage. ALWAYS avoid. Use extraction devices to clean void
de-rewards-desc: Chest of the Soo-Won (best in EoD). Chance for precursors, ascended, legendary materials. Antique Summoning Stone. Imperial Favor currency
amnytas-location-desc: Amnytas - Secrets of the Obscure. Kryptis city in the sky. Defend against demonic invasion
amnytas-phases-desc: Phase 1: Defend Ward Beacons (15 min). Phase 2: Boss Ignaxious (10 min). Total: 25 minutes. Main SotO meta
amnytas-beacons-desc: Defend 3 Ward Beacons from Kryptis. Squad splits into 3 groups. If beacon falls, respawns in 2 min. Protect beacons at all costs
amnytas-kryptis-desc: Demonic Kryptis enemies. Strong armor, void attacks. Champions very dangerous. Use CC and focus fire
amnytas-ignaxious-desc: Final Kryptis boss. Multiple phases. Massive AoE attacks, teleports, summons. Break CC bars. Stack for heals
amnytas-rifts-desc: Rifts constantly spawn adds. Prioritize closing rifts or adds overwhelm. Some people should focus only on rifts
amnytas-skyscale-desc: Vertical map. Skyscale mount essential for fast navigation between beacons. Without skyscale it's much harder
amnytas-rewards-desc: Defense of Amnytas Chest. Essences of Luck, Legendary Starter Kit materials. Obsidian Shards. 2-hour cooldown. Best SotO farm
bjora-location-desc: Bjora Marches - The Icebrood Saga Episode 2. Frozen Norn lands with Drakkar
bjora-metas-desc: Storms of Winter (Jora's Keep) and Champion of the Ice Dragon (Drakkar). Both important. Drakkar is the main one
bjora-drakkar-desc: Elder Dragon champion Drakkar. Massive boss on frozen lake. 3-phase fight. Requires organized 50-player squad
bjora-spirits-desc: Before Drakkar, free 4 Spirits of the Wild: Bear, Raven, Snow Leopard, Wolf. Each spirit grants special buffs for fight
bjora-phases-desc: Phase 1: Fight on ice. Phase 2: Drakkar dives, kill adds. Phase 3: Final burn. Each phase has unique ice attacks
bjora-ice-desc: Drakkar uses devastating ice attacks. Breath attacks, ice spikes, frozen ground. Dodge blue AoEs. Use consumables for cold resistance
bjora-aberrant-desc: Aberrant and Icebrood adds spawn constantly. Prioritize adds when Drakkar submerges. Don't let adds overwhelm you
bjora-rewards-desc: Drakkar's Hoard Chest. Eternal Ice Shards (IBS currency), ascended trinkets, Vision of Icebrood materials. 2-hour cooldown
grothmar-location-desc: Grothmar Valley - The Icebrood Saga Episode 1. Charr homeland with cultural events
grothmar-rotation-desc: Effigy (15 min), Doomlore Shrine (22 min), Ooze Pits (20 min), Metal Concert (15 min). Approximately 2-hour cycle
grothmar-effigy-desc: Ceremony of the Sacred Flame. Defend the Effigy while it burns. Kill attacking Branded. Simple but culturally important event
grothmar-doomlore-desc: The Haunting of Doomlore Shrine. Exorcise evil spirits. 3 phases. Final boss Ghost Eater. Best Grothmar event for rewards
grothmar-ooze-desc: Gladiatorial combat in the Ooze Pit. Fight waves of enemies. Champion final boss. Moderate DPS check. Fun event
grothmar-concert-desc: A Concert for the Ages. LIVE metal concert! Defend band from Branded. Most unique and memorable event. Epic soundtrack!
grothmar-casual-desc: All events are relatively casual. Don't require heavy coordination. Good for relaxed farming and learning Charr lore
grothmar-rewards-desc: Eternal Ice Shards, crafting materials, Black Lion Chest keys. Doomlore gives best rewards. Metal Concert gives unique achievement
seitung-location-desc: Seitung Province - End of Dragons. First Cantha zone. Coastal region with Aetherblade pirates
seitung-assault-desc: Main meta-event: Battle for the Jade Sea (Aetherblade Assault). Defend coast from massive pirate invasion. 30 minutes
seitung-phases-desc: Phase 1: Defend multiple points (15 min). Phase 2: Destroy Aetherblade ships (10 min). Phase 3: Boss Mai Trin (5 min)
seitung-maitr-desc: Captain Mai Trin appears as final boss. Mechanics: teleports, AoE circles, invulnerability phases. Split squad on multiple platforms
seitung-cannons-desc: Use Jade Tech cannons to destroy Aetherblade ships. Aim carefully! Cannons can also attack adds. Unlimited ammo
seitung-mechs-desc: Siege Turtle mounts and Jade Mechs are very useful. High DPS and sustain. Perfect for learning new Cantha mechanics
seitung-casual-desc: Relatively casual compared to Dragon's End. Good warm-up before harder metas. Map is always active
seitung-rewards-desc: Jade Runestones, Imperial Favor (EoD currency), rare drops. Research Notes. Lower rewards than Dragon's End but faster
kaineng-location-desc: New Kaineng City - End of Dragons. Cyberpunk metropolis with vertical towers and neon lights. Most impressive city in GW2
kaineng-blackout-desc: Main meta: Kaineng Blackout. Restore power to city during blackout. 45 minutes. Event chain across multiple districts
kaineng-districts-desc: Squad splits into 3-4 different districts. Each district has unique objectives. Requires coordination and tag commanders in each area
kaineng-generators-desc: Reactivate power generators in each district. Defend from Aetherblades and Jade Brotherhood. Generators are vulnerable - prioritize defense
kaineng-vertical-desc: Extremely vertical map! Use elevators, ziplines, springer/skyscale. Knowing routes is essential. Easy to get lost first times
kaineng-bosses-desc: Multiple mini-bosses appear in each district. Jade Mech, Aetherblade Captain, Brotherhood Leader. Moderate DPS check
kaineng-gangs-desc: Aetherblade vs Jade Brotherhood gang war. Both are enemies! Take advantage when they fight each other. Interesting story lore
kaineng-rewards-desc: Excellent Research Notes farm! Imperial Favor, Antique Summoning Stones, exotic gear. Good gold/hour. 2-hour cooldown
echovald-location-desc: Echovald Wilds - End of Dragons. Mystical petrified forest. Ancient trees transformed into jade/stone. Unique atmosphere
echovald-gangwar-desc: Main meta: The Gang War of Echovald. Brotherhood vs Speakers conflict. 40 minutes. Choose side or help both
echovald-sides-desc: Jade Brotherhood (crime syndicate) vs Speakers (spiritual order). Each faction controls territories. Dynamic events based on who dominates
echovald-capture-desc: Capture and hold strategic locations. Like WvW but PvE. Camps, outposts, fortifications. Squad must split to cover multiple points
echovald-minibosses-desc: Champion enemies roam the map. Brotherhood Enforcer, Speaker Champion. Hunt them for advantage. Important callouts!
echovald-finale-desc: Final boss: Winning faction's leader or Siege Turtle dual. Mechanics vary based on which faction dominated. High replayability
echovald-turtles-desc: Siege Turtle mount is EXTREMELY useful here! Co-op mount with gunner. High damage and mobility. Ideal for this meta
echovald-rewards-desc: Imperial Favor, Echovald-specific materials, Speaker/Brotherhood tokens. Faction reputation. Siege Turtle collection items
skywatch-location-desc: Skywatch Archipelago - Secrets of the Obscure. Floating islands in the sky. Wizards vs Kryptis. REQUIRES Skyscale mount mandatory!
skywatch-decima-desc: Main meta: Defeat Decima the Stormsinger. Flying Kryptis boss. 20 minutes. Dynamic fight on floating platforms
skywatch-phases-desc: Phase 1: Chase Decima (5 min). Phase 2: Platform defense (10 min). Phase 3: Final burn on main platform (5 min). Lots of movement!
skywatch-skyscale-desc: SKYSCALE MOUNT IS MANDATORY! Without skyscale you cannot participate. Many high platforms. Griffon doesn't work well here
skywatch-storms-desc: Decima creates devastating lightning storms. Blue electric AoEs. Wind gusts push you off platforms. Use stability!
skywatch-rifts-desc: Rifts constantly spawn Kryptis adds. Close rifts quickly or get overwhelmed. High priority! Some rifts require CC
skywatch-coordination-desc: Requires coordinated squad. Synchronized movement between platforms. Voice comms recommended. Harder than Amnytas
skywatch-rewards-desc: Essences of Luck, Obsidian Shards, Legendary materials. Decima's Hoard chest. 2-hour cooldown. Good rewards for time invested
nayos-location-desc: Inner Nayos - Secrets of the Obscure. Kryptis demon realm. Twisted nightmare landscape. Final SotO zone
nayos-convergence-desc: Main meta: The Midnight King's Convergence. Epic finale battle. 60 minutes! Longest SotO meta. Boss Eparch
nayos-preparation-desc: 40 minutes of preparation! Collect essences, defend points, kill champions. Successful prep is CRUCIAL to win. Similar to Dragon's End
nayos-eparch-desc: Midnight King Eparch - Kryptis overlord. 20-minute fight. Multiple phases. Complex mechanics. One-shot attacks. Heavy DPS check!
nayos-nightmare-desc: Eparch uses fear, confusion, mind control. Nightmare realm teleports. Clones and illusions. Constantly cleanse conditions!
nayos-split-desc: Squad splits into multiple groups during fight. Each group handles different mechanics simultaneously. Critical coordination!
nayos-difficulty-desc: Hardest SotO meta! Comparable to Dragon's End difficulty. Requires experienced squad. Many fail first tries. Practice needed!
nayos-rewards-desc: BEST SotO rewards! Legendary Starter Kit, Amalgamated Gemstones, ascended gear. Eparch's Hoard. Worth the effort!
syntri-location-desc: Janthir Syntri - Janthir Wilds expansion. Land of the Titans. First zone of new 2024 expansion. Epic mountainous landscape
syntri-rampart-desc: Main meta: The Stoic Rampart. Defend fortress from Titan invasions. 30 minutes. Massive event with multiple waves
syntri-waves-desc: Multiple waves of Titan forces attack. Each wave harder. Veterans, Elites, Champions progressively. Defend gates and walls!
syntri-titans-desc: New Titan enemy types! Powerful giants with heavy armor. High HP pools. Require focused fire and coordinated CC. Intimidating!
syntri-siege-desc: Use siege weapons at the fortress! Ballistae, catapults, cannons. High damage against Titans. Defend siege weapons from destruction
syntri-commander-desc: Final wave: Titan Commander boss. Massive! Mechanics: charges, AoE slams, summon adds. Heavy DPS check. Epic showdown!
syntri-difficulty-desc: Moderately difficult. Easier than Dragon's End but requires coordination. Good squad can win easily. Newcomer friendly!
syntri-rewards-desc: Janthir Wilds materials, Titan trophies, exotic gear. Stoic Rampart chest. New expansion currency. 2-hour cooldown. Generous loot!
lowland-location-desc: Lowland Shore - Janthir Wilds. Second expansion zone. Coastal region with ancient ruins. Breathtaking vistas!
lowland-threshold-desc: Main meta: Titan's Threshold. Confront Titan at ancient portal. 45 minutes. Epic boss encounter!
lowland-preparation-desc: 25 minutes of preparation. Collect ritual components, activate pylons, clear corruption. Prep quality affects boss difficulty
lowland-boss-desc: Boss Greer the Blightbringer. Titan corrupted entity. 20 minutes. Multiple phases with unique mechanics. Challenging!
lowland-corruption-desc: Greer spreads corruption zones. Green pools cause heavy DoT. Purify corruption with special skills. Spread out to avoid overlap!
lowland-pylons-desc: Activate pylons during fight for damage buff. 3 pylons in arena. Squad rotation between pylons. Timing is crucial!
lowland-adds-desc: Corrupted creatures spawn in waves. Prioritize Veterans and Elites quickly. Adds heal Greer if not controlled!
lowland-rewards-desc: Best Janthir Wilds rewards! Titan essences, ascended materials, rare drops. Greer's Treasure. 2-hour cooldown. Worth it!
